subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: The Apple Logo: A Bite of Genius
description: A quick, practical guide to The Apple Logo: A Bite of Genius.

hook.text: Apple's first logo was a detailed illustration of Newton under a tree. Steve Jobs hated it.

buildup.text: Rob Janoff designed the bitten apple in 1977. The bite was added so it wouldn't be confused with a cherry.

discovery.text: The rainbow stripes signaled that Apple had a color display ‚Äî a big deal when most screens were green.

twist.text: The logo has no connection to Alan Turing, the Garden of Eden, or knowledge. Those are beautiful myths.

climax.text: In 1998, Jobs removed the rainbow. The monochrome apple became the world's most valuable logo.

punchline.text: The bite was practical. The mythology was accidental.

quiz.question: Why does the Apple logo have a bite taken out?
options: So it wouldn't be confused with a cherry
